thread.title: 42 jobs lost as Datu Health closes its Boulder headquarters
thread.title_full: 42 jobs lost as Datu Health closes its Boulder headquarters - The Denver Post

author: Alicia Wallace
title: 42 jobs lost as Datu Health closes its Boulder headquarters
text:
Digital health company Datu Health has shuttered its Boulder headquarters as its software engineering functions are consolidated under the umbrella of its investment partner St. Joseph Health, officials confirmed Thursday.
Datu closed the Boulder office on Sept. 29, laying off 42 employees, company spokeswoman Pam Zients said. Four of the Boulder employees will remain with Datu, which has operations in St. Louis and California.
Datu developed software that tracks, analyzes and integrates personal health data and clinical results.
News Newsletter and Updates Subscribe for updates and our roundup on Front Range news, delivered to your inbox daily.
The company, originally a division of St. Louis-based Bick Group, has been backed by Irvine, Calif.-based St. Joseph Health since 2013, landing at least $35 million from the $5.5 billion hospital system. Datu grew to as many as 55 people in Boulder and the company recently was selected as a finalist in the Mayo Clinic's Think Big Challenge .
